intro: Otidia crithmifolia, commonly known as sea fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features aromatic, finely divided leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its adaptability to saline soils makes it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
